page.title: 13Haworth Education (cont.)
page.content: third of their fathers worked in {Haworth;}one was a farmer on a farm owned by the family for generations, two were firemen and two policemen.Of the mothers,9 worked in shops and hotels in the town. The children knew a wide variety of playground games though the boys seemed to favour football.They listed 11 ballgames including "Oliver, Oliver,Oliver Twist",10 skipping games ranging from the more traditional "Bluebells Cockleshells" to "I know a little bumper car",6 clapping games and 10 group games.Many were old:"What time is it Mr Wolf?" ,some modern: "Egg,bacon and chips" and "British bulldogs charge".There were also 10 dipping games for choosing a leader e.g."Mickey Mouse had a house." Although there were local variations little dialect was spoken.
